metadata.title: CVE-2023-52469 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drivers/amd/pm: fix a use-after-free in kv_parse_power_table When psallocated by kzalloc equals to NULL, kv_parse_power_table freesadev->pm.dpm.ps that allocated before. However, after the control flow goesthrough the following call chains: kv_parse_power_table |-> kv_dpm_init |->kv_dpm_sw_init |-> kv_dpm_fini The adev->pm.dpm.ps is used in the for loopof kv_dpm_fini after its first free in kv_parse_power_table and causes ause-after-free bug.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52469` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic-64k - 6.8.0-11.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-aws - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-azure - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1002-gcp - 6.8.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-ibm - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency - 6.8.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-oracle - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1001-raspi - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
